creator: Calfa
title: CS: GO Cuentra Atras Bomba con Arduino Mega + Display LCD 1602 + 2 Botones (+ English Version)
description: This project is a CS: GO bomb countdown timer using an Arduino Mega, an LCD 16x2 display, and two buttons. It provides a visual representation of the remaining time and simulates the bomb explosion when the timer reaches zero. It's a good exercise for beginners to practice with buttons, LCD displays, countdown programming, and using millis() for non-blocking delays.
steps: Connect the start and reset buttons to the protoboard in a pull-down configuration. Connect the start button to digital pin 2 and the reset button to digital pin 3 on the Arduino Mega.
Connect one pin of each button to GND through a 1-2 kOhm resistor, and the other pin to 5V.
Connect the LCD display's I2C driver. Connect GND to Arduino's GND, Vcc to Arduino's 5V, SDA to Arduino's SDA (pin 20 on Arduino Mega), and SCL to Arduino's SCL (pin 21 on Arduino Mega).
Upload the provided Arduino code to the Arduino Mega board.
Press the 'Start' button to begin the countdown from 40 seconds. The LCD will display the remaining time and a progress bar.
Press the 'Reset' button to reset the timer.
When the timer reaches zero, the LCD will display 'BBBBOOOOOOOOMMMM' and reset the program.
